Detailed Description

template<class t>
class eternity::factory< t >

factory<t> is responsable for the creation of object derived by the class t at run-time.

Member Function Documentation

◆ create()

template<class t >
void * eternity::factory< t >::create ( std::string &  class_name)
virtual

create an instance from class t if the same specified in class_name

Return a pointer to a new istance of the class t (the only template parmeter of factory<t>) only if the string class_name is actually the name of class t. Otherwise return a NULL pointer

Implements eternity::Ifactory.

Definition at line 123 of file dynamic.hpp.

◆ get_conventional_name()

template<class t >
std::string eternity::factory< t >::get_conventional_name ( std::string &  compiler_name)
virtual

Return the conventional name of class t if typeid(t).name() match with compiler_name. Otherwise return an empty.

Implements eternity::Ifactory.
